briefTitle: Amoxicillin Versus Benzyl Penicillin for Treatment of Children Hospitalised With Severe Pneumonia
officialTitle: Amoxicillin Versus Benzyl Penicillin for Severe Childhood Pneumonia Amongst Inpatients: An Open Label Randomised Controlled Non-inferiority Trial
summary: This study seeks to determine whether clinical outcome following initial treatment of severe pneumonia with oral amoxicillin is as effective as the current standard benzyl penicillin. The study will also provide an estimate of the proportion of Kenyan children with severe pneumonia who fail treatment with a single antibiotic.

primaryOutcome.measure: Treatment Failure at 48 Hours (Two Full Days After Enrollment)
